channel.title: Make the server run on a certain IP?
channel.description:
Upon giving out spots on my Dedicated Server, I need a way for the Private Servers to run on a certain IP.
How can I set the server to run on a specific, dedicated IP?

item.title: Make the server run on a certain IP?
item.dc:creator: @Superd00d Superd00d
item.description:
@Superd00d wrote:

Sure. My co owner keeps the server I when he can, but your not gonna me able to do much at the moment.

Read full topic

item.source: Make the server run on a certain IP?

item.title: Make the server run on a certain IP?
item.dc:creator: @Superd00d Superd00d
item.description:
@Superd00d wrote:

[quote=“relmitos, post:1, topic:323399”][quote author=Superd00d link=topic=419779.msg3083852#msg3083852 date=1262370693]

In the Server class you’ll see this:

clientListener = new java.net.ServerSocket(ServerlistenerPort, 1, null);

The “null” stands for the adress it’s bound to, null is default.
[/quote] No, that isn’t right. You would open up GUI.java. Or EGUI.java in your client folder. It doesn’t matter which. I would give you the code, but Im not on my computer at the moment. I can’t remember if that’s the correct code. I’m pretty sure it was something like serverip=SERVERIPHERE but that’s not All of the code. I cancer you it once I can.

Hush noob.[/quote] Just trying to help sorry.

Read full topic
item.source: Make the server run on a certain IP?

item.title: Make the server run on a certain IP?
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

clientListener = new java.net.ServerSocket(ServerlistenerPort, 1, java.net.InetAddress.getByName("128.44.3.138"));

Read full topic

item.title: Make the server run on a certain IP?

item.description:
@dharok1337 wrote:

I would find the Server class file, open it up, find that and replace null with the IP?

item.source: Make the server run on a certain IP?

item.title: Make the server run on a certain IP?
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

In the Server class you’ll see this:

clientListener = new java.net.ServerSocket(ServerlistenerPort, 1, null);

The “null” stands for the adress it’s bound to, null is default.

Read full topic
